meanings.definition: To give notice of impending danger or harm.
meanings.sent1: I must warn you about the storm approaching.
meanings.sent2: She warned her friend about the icy road ahead.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel warned the birds about the sneaky cat nearby.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds warned of the heavy rain to come.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder warned us to seek shelter quickly.

meanings.definition: To advise or caution about something.
meanings.sent1: Please warn me if the water is too hot.
meanings.sent2: He warned the children not to play near the busy street.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl warned the young rabbits about the clever fox.
meanings.sent4: Her tired expression warned him of her frustration.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict tone warned the students to pay attention.

meanings.definition: To inform someone in advance about a possible danger or problem.
meanings.sent1: I will warn you before the meeting starts.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard warned the swimmers of the strong currents.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog warned the family of the visitor at the door.
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse warned ships of the rocky shore.
meanings.sent5: The smell of smoke warned them of the fire in the kitchen.
